problem: Are those incapable of reproduction incapable of parenthood?
gt_solution:
Surrogates are women who will carry a baby to term for a family seeking to adopt.
Many children are put into the adoption and foster system every year and are always available to adopt, independent of the parents reproductive status.
facts: Surrogates are women who will carry a baby to term for a family seeking to adopt.
Many children are put into the adoption and foster system every year and are always available to adopt, independent of the parents reproductive status.
decomposition: What purpose do adoption and foster systems serve?
Do #1 and #2 fail to help couples incapable of reproduction become parents?
